trans-unit.source: Testing Traffic Manager Settings | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Testing Traffic Manager Settings | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: This article will help you test Traffic Manager settings
trans-unit.target: This article will help you test Traffic Manager settings

trans-unit.source: Testing Traffic Manager Settings
trans-unit.target: Testing Traffic Manager Settings

trans-unit.source: The best way to test your Traffic Manager settings is to set up a number of clients and then bring the endpoints, consisting of cloud services and websites, in your profile down one at a time.
trans-unit.target: The best way to test your Traffic Manager settings is to set up a number of clients and then bring the endpoints, consisting of cloud services and websites, in your profile down one at a time.

trans-unit.source: The following tips will help you test your Traffic Manager profile.
trans-unit.target: The following tips will help you test your Traffic Manager profile.

trans-unit.source: Basic testing steps
trans-unit.target: Basic testing steps

trans-unit.source: **Set the DNS TTL very low** so that changes will propagate quickly - 30 seconds, for example.
trans-unit.target: **Set the DNS TTL very low** so that changes will propagate quickly - 30 seconds, for example.

trans-unit.source: **Know the IP addresses of your Azure cloud services and websites** in the profile you are testing.
trans-unit.target: **Know the IP addresses of your Azure cloud services and websites** in the profile you are testing.

trans-unit.source: **Use tools that let you resolve a DNS name to an IP address** and display that address.
trans-unit.target: **Use tools that let you resolve a DNS name to an IP address** and display that address.

trans-unit.source: You are checking to see that your company domain name resolves to IP addresses of the endpoints in your profile.
trans-unit.target: You are checking to see that your company domain name resolves to IP addresses of the endpoints in your profile.

trans-unit.source: They should resolve in a manner consistent with the traffic routing method of your Traffic Manager profile.
trans-unit.target: They should resolve in a manner consistent with the traffic routing method of your Traffic Manager profile.

trans-unit.source: If you are on a computer running Windows, you can use the Nslookup.exe tool from a command or Windows PowerShell prompt.
trans-unit.target: If you are on a computer running Windows, you can use the Nslookup.exe tool from a command or Windows PowerShell prompt.

trans-unit.source: Other publicly available tools that allow you to "dig" an IP address are also readily available on the Internet.
trans-unit.target: Other publicly available tools that allow you to "dig" an IP address are also readily available on the Internet.

trans-unit.source: To check a Traffic Manager profile using nslookup
trans-unit.target: To check a Traffic Manager profile using nslookup

trans-unit.source: Open a command or Windows PowerShell prompt as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: Open a command or Windows PowerShell prompt as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: Type `ipconfig /flushdns` to flush the DNS resolver cache.
trans-unit.target: Type `ipconfig /flushdns` to flush the DNS resolver cache.

trans-unit.source: Type `nslookup <your Traffic Manager domain name>`.
trans-unit.target: Type `nslookup <your Traffic Manager domain name>`.

trans-unit.source: For example, the following command checks the domain name with the prefix *myapp.contoso*:
trans-unit.target: For example, the following command checks the domain name with the prefix *myapp.contoso*:

trans-unit.source: nslookup myapp.contoso.trafficmanager.net
trans-unit.target: nslookup myapp.contoso.trafficmanager.net

trans-unit.source: A typical result will show the following:
trans-unit.target: A typical result will show the following:

trans-unit.source: The DNS name and IP address of the DNS server being accessed to resolve this Traffic Manager domain name.
trans-unit.target: The DNS name and IP address of the DNS server being accessed to resolve this Traffic Manager domain name.

trans-unit.source: The Traffic Manager domain name you typed on the command line after "nslookup" and the IP address to which the Traffic Manager domain resolves.
trans-unit.target: The Traffic Manager domain name you typed on the command line after "nslookup" and the IP address to which the Traffic Manager domain resolves.

trans-unit.source: The second IP address is the important one to check.
trans-unit.target: The second IP address is the important one to check.

trans-unit.source: It should match a public virtual IP (VIP) address for one of the cloud services or websites in the Traffic Manager profile you are testing.
trans-unit.target: It should match a public virtual IP (VIP) address for one of the cloud services or websites in the Traffic Manager profile you are testing.

trans-unit.source: Testing traffic routing methods
trans-unit.target: Testing traffic routing methods

trans-unit.source: To test a failover traffic routing method
trans-unit.target: To test a failover traffic routing method

trans-unit.source: Leave all endpoints up.
trans-unit.target: Leave all endpoints up.

trans-unit.source: Use a single client.
trans-unit.target: Use a single client.

trans-unit.source: Request DNS resolution for your company domain name using the Nslookup.exe tool or a similar utility.
trans-unit.target: Request DNS resolution for your company domain name using the Nslookup.exe tool or a similar utility.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that the resolved IP address your obtain is for your primary endpoint
trans-unit.target: Ensure that the resolved IP address your obtain is for your primary endpoint

trans-unit.source: Bring your primary endpoint down or remove the monitoring file so that Traffic Manager thinks it’s down.
trans-unit.target: Bring your primary endpoint down or remove the monitoring file so that Traffic Manager thinks it’s down.

trans-unit.source: Wait for the DNS Time-to-Live (TTL) of the Traffic Manager profile plus an additional 2 minutes.
trans-unit.target: Wait for the DNS Time-to-Live (TTL) of the Traffic Manager profile plus an additional 2 minutes.

trans-unit.source: For example, if your DNS TTL is 300 seconds (5 minutes), you must wait for 7 minutes.
trans-unit.target: For example, if your DNS TTL is 300 seconds (5 minutes), you must wait for 7 minutes.

trans-unit.source: Flush your DNS client cache and request DNS resolution.
trans-unit.target: Flush your DNS client cache and request DNS resolution.

trans-unit.source: In Windows, you can flush your DNS cache with the ipconfig /flushdns command issued at a command or Windows PowerShell prompt.
trans-unit.target: In Windows, you can flush your DNS cache with the ipconfig /flushdns command issued at a command or Windows PowerShell prompt.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that the IP address you obtain is for your secondary endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that the IP address you obtain is for your secondary endpoint.

trans-unit.source: Repeat the process, bringing down the secondary endpoint and then the tertiary and so on.
trans-unit.target: Repeat the process, bringing down the secondary endpoint and then the tertiary and so on.

trans-unit.source: Each time, be sure that the DNS resolution returns the IP address of the next endpoint in the list.
trans-unit.target: Each time, be sure that the DNS resolution returns the IP address of the next endpoint in the list.

trans-unit.source: When all endpoints are down, you should obtain the IP address of the primary endpoint again.
trans-unit.target: When all endpoints are down, you should obtain the IP address of the primary endpoint again.

trans-unit.source: To test a round robin traffic routing method
trans-unit.target: To test a round robin traffic routing method

trans-unit.source: Leave all endpoints up.
trans-unit.target: Leave all endpoints up.

trans-unit.source: Use a single client.
trans-unit.target: Use a single client.

trans-unit.source: Request DNS resolution for your company domain using the Nslookup.exe tool or a similar utility.
trans-unit.target: Request DNS resolution for your company domain using the Nslookup.exe tool or a similar utility.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that the IP address you obtain is one of those in your list.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that the IP address you obtain is one of those in your list.

trans-unit.source: Flush your DNS client cache and repeat steps 3 and 4 over and over.
trans-unit.target: Flush your DNS client cache and repeat steps 3 and 4 over and over.

trans-unit.source: You should see different IP addresses returned for each of your endpoints.
trans-unit.target: You should see different IP addresses returned for each of your endpoints.

trans-unit.source: Then, the process will repeat.
trans-unit.target: Then, the process will repeat.

trans-unit.source: To test a performance traffic routing method
trans-unit.target: To test a performance traffic routing method

trans-unit.source: To effectively test a performance traffic routing method, you must have clients located in different parts of the world.
trans-unit.target: To effectively test a performance traffic routing method, you must have clients located in different parts of the world.

trans-unit.source: You could create clients in Azure that will attempt to call your services via your company domain name.
trans-unit.target: You could create clients in Azure that will attempt to call your services via your company domain name.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, if your corporation is global, you can remotely log into clients in other parts of the world and test from those clients.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, if your corporation is global, you can remotely log into clients in other parts of the world and test from those clients.

trans-unit.source: There are free web-based DNS lookup and dig services available.
trans-unit.target: There are free web-based DNS lookup and dig services available.

trans-unit.source: Some of these give you the ability to check DNS name resolution from various locations.
trans-unit.target: Some of these give you the ability to check DNS name resolution from various locations.

trans-unit.source: Do a search on “DNS lookup” for examples.
trans-unit.target: Do a search on “DNS lookup” for examples.

trans-unit.source: Another option is to use a third-party solution like Gomez or Keynote to confirm that your profiles are distributing traffic as expected.
trans-unit.target: Another option is to use a third-party solution like Gomez or Keynote to confirm that your profiles are distributing traffic as expected.
